channel.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Locking Topics[Moderators etc]
channel.description:
When you lock a topic cause it's spam or whatever. Could it be possible to also change the title to like * or something of that matter? Here are my reasons for this:
1) If it was a server then the server could still be technically "advertised" by having the title there. 2) If it was a malicious item and had the name of the server/whatever. Could still be googled and could go to that infected site/whatever.
Edit: addition to this suggestion is found on this post
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,642889.msg4328960.html#msg4328960
[hr] Another suggestion is to make it when a topic is locked it gets "bumped down" so that way we don't have a locked topic being seen/as one of the main headlines in that specific/particular board at that time.
Reasons:
1) If for example, the first suggestion isn't implemented. A person who clicks on new posts for that board, will see the recently locked topic, see the title still there, and yeah... same reason as first then. [hr] Another suggestion is to have an "approve/disapprove" mod installed. This mod would regulate what can be seen by regular players.
Reasons: 1)It would just keep overall the forums looking better I believe. I believe VBulletin comes with a similar system already.

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Locking Topics[Moderators etc]
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

This is largely staff discretion, and it works fine like that. We have a general rule of thumb in regard to locking topics, and how many should be on each page. There isn’t a coded system that is required for everything, the forum has worked like this since forever and it will continue to do so. Any staff member that doesn’t use * appropriately to block out items such as a malicious link can be contacted and that can be amended, the same applies for too many locked topics or topics locked that people feel should have been removed.

[quote=“Arcik, post:12, topic:524346”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=642889.msg4328990#msg4328990 date=1373394691]
I feel like this is just another topic for you to post on, this isn’t an issue. If it’s not broken, don’t fix it.
[/quote]

I feel as if as this is more of a fix it board rather then suggestions. You guys are willing to add new things but all the old crap will not change or get removed.[/quote]

The board is entitled community suggestions because it’s for suggestions (“an idea or plan put forward for consideration”) please don’t mistake a suggestion being turned down in consideration for us blanket banning certain suggestion groups.

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Locking Topics[Moderators etc]
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Ruby, post:9, topic:524346”]I feel like this is just another topic for you to post on, this isn’t an issue. If it’s not broken, don’t fix it.[/quote]Really? Cause it’s the total opposite feeling here. I feel like you have some sort of issue wrong with me. And if you do you really should pm me so we can work it out.

This topic was purely a suggestion I thought of to help make the staff lives better. I have talked to you, to flame, to David, and even a couple of other mods before and all of you have talked about how at times it can be a hassle/the time it takes to do certain tasks.

MITB has already stated that the dedication the Mopar staff bring to the table is purely voluntary and thus I am of the mindset “let’s not waste more time than what’s needed for the volunteers.” If that includes making a system easier for a mod I don’t see the reasoning as to why not implement such an item.

From a production standpoint at that, easier the task is, more that can be done in a days time. More things that can be done by the same person equals less work overall and less people needed.

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Locking Topics[Moderators etc]
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:6, topic:524346”]@loveandnoob

There’s already a delete button, infractions can be given through user profiles and you can choose what send as a message.[/quote]I know that

I am referring to like an automatic system so there isn’t as much clicking involved for the moderators.

[hr]

Uncalled:

What’s wrong with the style of locking now? I like the second suggestion, but there’s no need to put more work on the way that moderators lock topics. This seems very redundant.

Hmm well let me change the first suggestion then some. Going back to the “cleaning” button idea of mine. It could automatically “clean” the title as well.

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Locking Topics[Moderators etc]
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

Si Force:

For your first suggestion, depending on the title moderators may sometimes censor a part of it. Mostly to do with advertising, though. However, if somebody googles the name of a server after a moderator has locked/censored the post and then become infected, that is their own fault for being ridiculous.

I agree it is their own fault but I’m sure it at least happens sometimes. While I’m sure it’s more than likely just a pity server owner who is trying to gain players…I like to try to be more of one those “safer than sorry” type of people but I understand where the line is there as well.

Si Force:

For your second suggestion, I actually like that idea. I’d love to see something implemented like this, it’d remove a slight guilt of locking multiple topics in a row within one board.

exactly!

Si Force:

As for your third one, I’m not quite sure I understand you. If you’re talking about a post approval/moderation mod, then SMF has one by default. See: Moderated users and moderated boards. Posts/topics in those instances require approval

Similar to that I guess… you know how ON VBulletin/IPB you are able to let’s say if you see spam or something you can check a box and then click “disapprove or hide”

[hr]

[quote=“the elve age, post:4, topic:524346”][quote author=Arcik link=topic=642889.msg4328950#msg4328950 date=1373389206]
imo just delete threads instead of locking etc if they’re really gay
[/quote]This. I don’t see why the spam topics have to be locked and ‘cleared’ of their title, it’s easier to just delete the spam topics and send the user (if not a spam user) a pm saying you deleted their topic because of _______.[/quote]I could see the usefulness of a tool in this. Maybe instead of a delete option it has a “clean” button for moderators. The clean button would

  1. Delete the post
  2. Open a window automatically for the moderator to use whatever infraction abilities they wish
  3. Allows the moderator to “customize” the alert message that will be sent to the user
  4. Anything else you guys can think of

Read full topic

item.title: [RESOLVED - DENIED] Locking Topics[Moderators etc]
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

For your first suggestion, depending on the title moderators may sometimes censor a part of it. Mostly to do with advertising, though. However, if somebody googles the name of a server after a moderator has locked/censored the post and then become infected, that is their own fault for being ridiculous.

For your second suggestion, I actually like that idea. I’d love to see something implemented like this, it’d remove a slight guilt of locking multiple topics in a row within one board.

As for your third one, I’m not quite sure I understand you. If you’re talking about a post approval/moderation mod, then SMF has one by default. See: Moderated users and moderated boards. Posts/topics in those instances require approval
